conclusion: Initial conditions of the problem are stated.
Pressure exerted by the gas balances the weight of the piston in equilibrium.
Calculation of pressure inside the cylinder when the elevator is stationary.
Maximum tension the rope can withstand is given.
Tension in the rope is balanced by the combined weight of the piston and cylinder.
Calculation shows the elevator will not break the rope even at maximum tension.

Calculation of pressure inside the cylinder when the elevator accelerates upwards.
Boyle's Law is used for the isothermal process.
Calculation of maximum distance the piston can reach using Boyle's Law.
